data.title: [scss] Option to remove scss functions from property autocomplete
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.51
- OS Version: Sierra

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2827047/18947829/eae40254-8634-11e6-813d-fb57ea8d7221.png)

This type of behaviour is highly unpractical, since in 99.9% of cases I want to select a css property. Either group scss functions after css properties or add an option to turn them off.

data.title: Can't install "Latest Typescript ..." extension
data.body: Due to #12843

data.title: How can I use the existing Language Service Host for JavaScript?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,
I would like to write a VSCode Extension. It will support JavaScript IntelliSense in a HTML file.
For own TypeScript code I used a own TypeScript Language Server Host.  

I like to save a lot of time and would use the existing Language Service Host for JavaScript from VSCode.
So I can support default JS functions and properties... As example, I have a own TypeScript property from type string.. and I would support the string functions like .replace, .length, .sub etc.

Does anyone have an idea?

Gregor

data.title: Shortcut to toggle (show and hide) explorer view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the _Explorer_ view by pressing `Ctrl+Shift+E`
2. Press again `Ctrl+Shift+E` to open the _Explorer_ view

Expected result:
The _Explorer_ view will open and will be visible to the user

Actual result:
The _Explorer_ view doesn't open. `Ctrl+Shift+E` works only for closing the view.

data.title: Strange formatting for Razor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Insiders - OS Version: Windows 10 Regarding test item #12100 Steps to Reproduce: 1. This may not be a problem and might just be me. Open a large .cshtml file (try the one I link to below) and select everything. 2. Press Shift + Tab several times to collapse all the hierarchy and mess up its formatting. 3. Now Format the file 4. Notice that the file formats weird as pictured below (maybe it's just [my file](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-website/blob/3cfa8213681f680418997c7671fa1b8c452ac2af/website/Views/Docs/extensions/example-word-count.cshtml)). **Original file before I used Shift+Tab several times** **After format** What's with the white space in the middle of the code? Maybe this file uses spaces, maybe it has mixed tabs and spaces and this had something to do with it? Notice how some of the tags that are nested are all linline still. I would expect a more opinionated format of nesting these more in a block way. Please feel free to close if it's just me :)

data.title: Razor doesn't auto indent on inserting new tag
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Regarding test plan item #12100

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In a Razor file, add a tag and then press enter/return to go to next line.
2. Note that it is not auto-indented in a level like it is currently on Stable.

![insiders not indenting razor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18942689/7c4b18e2-85cf-11e6-93ef-5fbc6027907a.gif)

1. Type `"""` on a new line
2. Observe that `"""` autocompletes to `""""` with the cursor before between the third and forth `"`.

Regarding test plan item #12100

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select all the contents of an html file that has a script tag block somewhere in it (mine was at the bottom)

This also is a problem in Stable, and Stable also has another problem where the selection no longer includes everything.

data.title: Pressing enter before a closing tag that was just created indents it in a level
data.body: - VSCode Version: Insiders - OS Version: Windows 10 Regarding test plan item #12100 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Type `` 2. Your cursor will be between this pair of tags. Now hit enter/return to send the closing tag to the next line. 3. Note that the newest build of Insiders puts this tag indented in a level, whereas stable more correctly has it at the same indent level. **Insiders** ![insiders2 add div](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18941683/f0be06ce-85c7-11e6-81c4-194055f1e6b4.gif) **Stable** ![stable - add div](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18941682/f0bcc714-85c7-11e6-9c47-e20bd650869a.gif) Sorry for the motion sickness of watching these 2 gifs side-by-side 🌊

Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12658

Right now it's only a list of extension names, but listing the versions as well would be exceedingly helpful for narrowing down potential install issues w/ extensions

data.title: engines.vscode property not appearing in package.json intellisense
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12658

As you can see, the property is completion-less
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18937293/c4ef9db0-85a3-11e6-919f-e9716b91fe61.png)

Additionally, I think better [documentation](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/tools/vscecli) about what sort of semver range support exists would also be helpful. e.g Carets appear to be supported, what about other forms of range specification?

data.title: Page-Up in git commit text box shifts everything to the left hiding the activity bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 and 1.6 insiders (9/27)
- OS Version: Windows (doesnt happen in Mac)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the Git view, enter multiple lines of text into the commit message text box, until the scroll bar appears.
2. While the text box is focused, press Page-Up / Page-Down.

The entire page is shifted left such that the activity bar is hidden and there is some empty space on the right.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/18937181/c27b1736-85a2-11e6-9cec-16ef2328f598.png)

data.title: Never-ending extension "update available" loop after updating vscode.engines property
data.body:
Testing #12658 (Windows)

Repro steps:
1. Publish [test-extension-pack-1](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/extension-deps-sample) 
2. install extension, restart vscode
3. Increment the version and change the vscode.engines property to `"^1.7.0"`, publish again
4. Search for extension in marketplace

**Expected:**
"no update" button doesn't appear or some warning about the latest version being incompatible w/ vscode

**Actual:**
Extension pack appears with update button
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18936945/c0c98546-85a0-11e6-8dc1-42d424b6570d.png)

Clicking the update button "installs" the extension, adds an "enable" button, but doesn't disable the "update" button
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18936961/ec85854a-85a0-11e6-87dd-292002b11573.png)

Press Update button a couple more times (for science!)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18936970/00b6b2fa-85a1-11e6-921e-0c65ae3871d4.png)

Press Enable button, restart VSCode

Search again, extension not installed.... Repeat, ad infinitum

data.title: Adding a new dependency to an installed extension pack does not yield "would you like to install dependencies" prompt
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12658

Repro steps:
1. adding a new extension to the dependencies of a published and installed extension pack
2. increment the version of the extension pack
3. update the extension pack from VSCode

Expected: prompt asking if I also want dependencies to be installed
Actual: no prompt, which seems inconsistent with the rest of the experience

data.title: Extension not appearing in @outdated list
data.body:
Testing #12658 (Windows)

After publishing [test-extension-pack-1](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/extension-deps-sample), I updated it to add another dependency to it, and also incremented the version. After it was published, the extensions pane never updated to inform me of an updated version, and queries for `@outdated` were similarly unsuccessful. Restarting VSCode and waiting did nothing either.

Eventually, I searched the marketplace for that extension, and it popped up into the list, with the appropriate Update / Uninstall buttons, which in turn prompted the outdated list to be updated (extension appears in `@outdated` query)
